intro: [WRONG START] Thtodaya, commonly known as the "scented orchid," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. Thtodaya species are characterized by their fragrant, showy flowers that often have a complex, spicy scent. They typically grow as epiphytes or terrestrials, attaching themselves to trees or thriving in moist, shaded environments. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral structures and color variations.
